{"blocks":[{"key":"do6u8","text":"Prepare a stock solution of the IS in   and store it at −80 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":38,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7b2j0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72d32","text":"Prepare fresh solutions of each metabolite in   and use them to make four mixtures: MIX1 [dopamine (DA), noradrenaline (NA), 3-methoxytyramine (3MT), 3,4-dihydroxyphenylalanine (L-DOPA) and aminochrome (AC)],  MIX2 [3,4-Dihydroxyphenylacetic\nacid (DOPAC), 3,4-dihydroxymandelic acid (DOMA) and vanillylmandelic acid (VMA)], MIX3 [5SCD and 5SCDA] and MIX4 [serotonin(5-HT), tryptophan (Trp) and 5-hydroxyindole-3-acetic acid (5-HIAA)].","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":46,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"25","error_concentration":false,"guid":"0296BC70334011EDAE30C9600A6AA447","id":0,"label":"FA in water","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"25","error_concentration":false,"guid":"E3018468334511EDB0470A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"FA in water","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28}}}}

steps.section: UPLC-MS/MS analysis for catecholaminergic, serotonergic and cholinergic determination
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"82b2i","text":"The mobile phase for MIX1-4 consisted of solvent A (methanol 100%) and solvent B (25 mM FA in MQ water) at a flow of 0.4 mL/min with the following gradient profiles (depending on the MIX):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d646f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"327ta","text":"MIX1 and MIX2:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fp6t","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kvt0","text":"0.5% B maintained for 0.5 min, 5% B at 0.9 min and maintained for 2.1min, 50% B at 2.8 min and maintained for 1.2 min, 0.5% B at 4.1 min followed by 0.2 min of equilibration. Total run time 4.3 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jbgr","text":"0.5","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"badlj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"140i5","text":"MIX3:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gmfi","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vbqe","text":"0.5% B maintained for 0.5 min, 8% B at 2.6 min, 50% B at 2.9 min and maintained for 0.6 min, 0.5% B at 3.7 min maintained 0.2 min for equilibration. Total run time 3.7 min","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43f7a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmr7e","text":"MIX4:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72vvq","text":"1%B maintained for 0.5 min, 25 % B at 3 min, 50 % B at 3.1 min and maintained for 0.5 min, 1 % B at 3.6 min maintained 0.4 min for equilibration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: UPLC-MS/MS analysis for catecholaminergic, serotonergic and cholinergic determination
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dcn6o","text":"The mass spectrometer detector operates under the following parameters: source temperature 150 ºC, desolvation temperature 450 ºC, cone gas flow 50 L/hr, desolvation gas flow 1100 L/hr and collision gas flow 0.15 mL/min. Argon is used as the collision gas. The capillary voltage was set at: 0.5 kV (MIX1, MIX3 and MIX3-PB), 2 kV (MIX2) or 3kV (MIX4, ACh). The electrospray ionization (ESI) source was operated in both positive and negative modes, depending on the analyte.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cld9r","text":"Take    of sample for ACh determination:  dilute 1:4 with    containing a final concentration of 100 nM of ACh-4d as IS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":5,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":58,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"63gub","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"55","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"FA in ACN","scientificNotation":false,"unit":14}}}}

steps.section: UPLC-MS/MS analysis for catecholaminergic, serotonergic and cholinergic determination
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dqs74","text":"A Waters Acquity™ UPLC system is coupled with a Xevo TQ-S triple quadrupole mass spectrometer with electrospray ionization interface (Waters). Instrument control, data acquisition, and analysis is performed using MassLynx V4.1 (Waters). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: UPLC-MS/MS analysis for catecholaminergic, serotonergic and cholinergic determination
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5s50v","text":"An Acquity HSS T3 (1.8 μm, 2.1 mm × 100 mm) column coupled to an Acquity HSS T3 VanGuard (100 Å, 1.8 μm, 2.1 mm × 5 mm) pre-column is used to detect MIX1-3 analytes. Column temperature is set at 45 ºC and samples are maintained at 6 ºC in the thermostatic autosampler.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: UPLC-MS/MS analysis for catecholaminergic, serotonergic and cholinergic determination
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"78qpb","text":"An Acquity UPLC BEH C18 (1.7μm, 2.1x100mm) column coupled to a Acquity BEH C18 1.7μM VanGuard pre-column is used to detect MIX4. Column temperature is set at 55 ºC and samples are maintained at 6ºC in the thermostatic autosampler.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: UPLC-MS/MS analysis for catecholaminergic, serotonergic and cholinergic determination
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8m6uo","text":"A Cortecs UPLC HILIC (1.6 µm; 2,1x75 mm) column coupled to a Cortecs UPLC HILIC VanGuard pre-column (Waters) is used for ACh determination. Column temperature is set at 50 ºC and samples\nare maintained at 6 ºC in the thermostatic autosampler. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3d5o4","text":"Serially dilute acetylcholine (ACh) standard with   to obtain a calibration curve covering a range of 0.2-1000 nM","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":50,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"0.1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"FE9FCF2C561B11EFBCE90A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"FA in acetonitrile (ACN)","scientificNotation":false,"unit":14}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"asr19","text":"For ACh calibration curve, distribute the sample into   aliquots prior to the addition of   of the working mixture and   of   in 0.1% FA in ACN. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":54,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":90,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":119,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":124,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"90","error":false,"guid":"5F265840334211EDAE30C9600A6AA447","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"30","error":false,"guid":"767153B0334211EDAE30C9600A6AA447","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"120","concentration":"25","error":false,"error_concentration":false,"guid":"CFB1B9F0334311EDAE30C9600A6AA447","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"3":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"24","concentration":"200","error":false,"error_concentration":false,"guid":"60664060334411EDAE30C9600A6AA447","id":0,"label":"IS (ACh-4d)","scientificNotation":false,"unit":30}}}}

steps.section: UPLC-MS/MS analysis for catecholaminergic, serotonergic and cholinergic determination
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7ke8v","text":"The mobile phase for ACh determination consisted of solvent A (0.1% FA in ACN) and solvent B (10 mM ammonium acetate in MilliQ water) at a flow of 0.5 mL/min with isocratic 70% A- 30% B conditions during 2.2 min. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: UPLC-MS/MS analysis for catecholaminergic, serotonergic and cholinergic determination

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"87jik","text":"Samples with a concentration between the limit of detection (LOD) and limit of quantification (LOQ) or bigger than LOQ are considered acceptable; samples with a concentration lower than LOD are considered \nas the LOD value. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bke6b","text":"Catechol oxidation is measured using the formula AC+5SCDA+5SCDA-PB/DA + 5SCD+5SCD-PB/L-DOPA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"97sob","text":"DA synthesis is measured using the formula DA+NE+DOMA+VMA+ 3MT+DOPAC /L- DOPA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bliup","text":"DA degradation is measured using the formula DOPAC+3MT/DA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"378ka","text":"Data is normalised by the protein concentration (determined by BCA) and presented as the percentage of the wt concentration or ratio.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
